text: In this video, we're going to show you

three ways to check the
battery life of your AirPods.
You can check on your iPhone or iPad,

if your AirPods are still
in their charging case.
First, check that Bluetooth is turned on
on your iPhone or iPad
by swiping up from the bottom
and checking the Bluetooth symbol is blue.

Hold your AirPods near
to the paired device
and open the case.

A pop-up will appear at
the bottom of the screen

showing the battery life of
the AirPods and their case.
If you want to check the battery life
while you're wearing the AirPods,

you'll need to enable the battery
widget on the widget page.
Find the battery widget

and click the green plus
to enable the widget.

You'll now see the battery
percentage of your AirPods
on your widget page.
If your AirPods are paired with your Mac,

you can view the battery
life from the desktop.
If you're wearing your AirPods,

you'll be able to view the
battery life on screen.
Hover over your AirPods
in the Bluetooth drop-down menu.

You'll see the battery
life displayed here.
If you're not connected to any devices,

you'll be able to get
an approximate reading

of the battery life by
checking inside the case.

If it's green here, the
AirPods are over 50% charged.

If it's amber, they're
less than 50% charged.
